text:
A cumulative distribution function (cdf), or simply distribution function, defines the
probability that a random variable, X, takes on a value equal to or less than a specific
value, x. It represents the sum, or cumulative value, of the probabilities for the outcomes
up to and including a specified outcome. The cumulative distribution function for a
random variable, X, may be expressed as F(x) = P(X < x).
